content: Seung Jun Baek is a full professor of Computer Science and Engineering at Korea University. Prof. Baek received Ph.D. and M.S. degrees at University of Texas at Austin, and B.S. degree at Seoul National University, all in Electrical and Computer Engineering. He was a Member Technical Staff of DSP Systems R&D center, Communication and Medical Systems Lab. of Texas Instruments. He is now a full professor at Computer Science and Engr. Dept, Artificial Intelligence Dept. and Data Science Dept. of College of Informatics, Korea University. His research interests are on the design of intelligent systems in the areas including deep learning, medical AI, generative models, language models, graph learning, mobile- and fog/edge computing. He leads the System INtelligence Group (SING).
summary: Seung Jun Baek is a full professor of Computer Science and Engineering at Korea University. Prof. Baek received Ph.D. and M.S. degrees at University of Texas at Austin, and B.S. degree at Seoul National University, all in Electrical and Computer Engineering.
title: Seung Jun Baek

content:
吳恩達 is a professor of artificial intelligence at the Stanford AI Lab. His research interests include distributed robotics, mobile computing and programmable matter. He leads the Robotic Neurobiology group, which develops self-reconfiguring robots, systems of self-organizing robots, and mobile sensor networks.
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed neque elit, tristique placerat feugiat ac, facilisis vitae arcu. Proin eget egestas augue. Praesent ut sem nec arcu pellentesque aliquet. Duis dapibus diam vel metus tempus vulputate.
summary: 吳恩達 is a professor of artificial intelligence at the Stanford AI Lab. His research interests include distributed robotics, mobile computing and programmable matter. He leads the Robotic Neurobiology group, which develops self-reconfiguring robots, systems of self-organizing robots, and mobile sensor networks.
title: 吳恩達

content:
Flexibility This feature can be used for publishing content such as:
Online courses Project or software documentation Tutorials The courses folder may be renamed. For example, we can rename it to docs for software/project documentation or tutorials for creating an online course.
Delete tutorials To remove these pages, delete the courses folder and see below to delete the associated menu link.
Update site menu After renaming or deleting the courses folder, you may wish to update any [[main]] menu links to it by editing your menu configuration at config/_default/menus.toml.
For example, if you delete this folder, you can remove the following from your menu configuration:
[[main]] name = "Courses" url = "courses/" weight = 50 Or, if you are creating a software documentation site, you can rename the courses folder to docs and update the associated Courses menu configuration to:
[[main]] name = "Docs" url = "docs/" weight = 50 Update the docs menu If you use the docs layout, note that the name of the menu in the front matter should be in the form [menu.X] where X is the folder name. Hence, if you rename the courses/example/ folder, you should also rename the menu definitions in the front matter of files within courses/example/ from [menu.example] to [menu.<NewFolderName>].
summary: Learn how to use Academic's docs layout for publishing online courses, software documentation, and tutorials.
title: Overview

content:
고려대학교 컴퓨터학과-의료원 연합의 명품인재 사업단이 과기정통부에서 주관하는 ICT 명품인재양성사업에 선정됐습니다. 총연구비 300억, 연구기간 10년 (2020~2029)의 최대 규모의 과제입니다.
연구 주제는 기존의 인공지능의 한계를 뛰어넘어 의료진과 협업이 가능한 수준의 초지능 분야로, 영상의학, 재활의학, 감염의학으로 분과됩니다. 지능시스템연구실은 고대의료원과 함께 재활지능 팀을 리드합니다.
사업을 통해 고려대 컴퓨터학과 대학원에 인공지능응용전공을 신설하며, 도전적인 인공지능 문제를 해결할 인재를 양성하는데 집중하고 있습니다.
현재 대학원, 혹은 학부연구생에 많은 오프닝이 있으니 컨택 바랍니다.
title: ICT 명품인재 사업 (연구비:300억, 기간:10년) 선정!

content:
고려대학교 컴퓨터학과 사업단이 두뇌한국21플러스 (BK21 plus) 사업에 예비 선정됐습니다 (관련 기사: ‘4단계 두뇌한국(BK)21’ 68개 대학 선정…7년간 2조 9천억 지원)
우리 대학은 이 사업을 통해 대학원 중심의 연구 역량을 키우고 심화된 데이터 과학 및 인공지능에 중점을 둔 교육과정을 운용할 계획이며 지능시스템연구실 참여 사업입니다.
관련하여 대학원 및 학부연구생의 지원 및 오프닝이 있으니 컨택 바랍니다.
title: BK21 플러스 사업 예비 선정!

content: We focus on the design and optimization of deep learning systems processing multi-modal data covering image, text, video, graphs, time-series data, and more.
title: Deep Learning Systems
Blockchain of Finite-Lifetime Blocks with Applications to Edge-based IoT

content: We research on generative AI to synthesize multi-modal data encompassing text, image, video, speech, etc., to create contents for applications such as data augmentation, medical AI, gaming and interactive visual/voice assistants.
title: Generative AI

content: We research on language models such as Large Language Models (LLMs), Vision-Language Models (VLMs), Multi-Modal Language Models (MLLMs) and Small Language Models (SLMs) and related topics such as retrieval, in-context learning, instruction tuning, human alignment, etc.
title: Language Models

content: We research on AI methodologies such as computer vision, natural language processing, graph learning, etc., to build systems of medical superintelligence to create AI agents which can assist experts with diagnostics, surgical assitance, personalized medicine and real-time virtual health assistants.
title: Medical AI

content: Graphs are primary representation of information systems such as social networks, drug discovery, recommendation systems, knowledge base, etc. In this research, we study algorithms to learn and predict graph structures on a large scale powered by deep learning.
title: Graph Learning

content: Autonomous navigation systems require timely decision making and collaboration to ensure safety. In this research, we study a real-time fusion of various sensor data, for example, vision, LiDAR, radar data in collaborative environments.
title: Data fusion for autonomous navigation

content: We research on AI technologies combined with mobile and distributed systems, such as lightweight AI algorithms for mobile systems, AI for edge/fog networks, federated learning, and mobile AI agents, etc.
title: Mobile Systems and AI

content:
Create slides in Markdown with Academic Academic | Documentation
Features Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides Controls Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click PDF Export: E Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...") Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}} Press Space to play!
One **Two** Three A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}} Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view Themes black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}} Custom CSS Example Let’s make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; } Questions? Ask
Documentation
summary: An introduction to using Academic's Slides feature.
title: Slides

Joint routing and scheduling for data collection with compressive sensing to achieve order-optimal latency
Energy-Efficient Collection of Sparse Data in Wireless Sensor Networks Using Sparse Random Matrices
Distributed Power Allocation for Femtocell Networks Subject to Macrocell SINR Balancing
Application of precise indoor position tracking to immersive virtual reality with translational movement support
Opportunistic Scheduling of Randomly Coded Multicast Transmissions at Half-Duplex Relay Stations
Minimum Cost Data Aggregation for Wireless Sensor Networks Computing Functions of Sensed Data
Securing one-way hash chain based incentive mechanism for vehicular ad hoc networks
A Highly Parallelized Decoder for Random Network Coding leveraging GPGPU
Sufficient Conditions on Stable Recovery of Sparse Signals With Partial Support Information
Integrating Random Network Coding with On-Demand Multicast Routing Protocol
Opportunistic Feedback and Scheduling to Reduce Packet Delays in Heterogeneous Wireless Systems
Reducing Feedback Overhead in  Opportunistic Scheduling of Wireless Networks Exploiting Overhearing
Delay-Optimal Opportunistic Scheduling and Approximations: The Log Rule
Retrieval of the Extreme Values under Deadline Constraints in Wireless Sensor Networks
